page.title: 04ST. PETERS WITH ALL SAINTS
page.content: St. Peters Church is closely linked with the Benedictine Abbey founded in Chertsey in 666. The present church dates from l310 although only the tower and chancel remain, the rest being rebuilt in Gothic style in the l9th century. During the l970's, the Anglicans, Congregationists and Methodists were faced with extensive repairs so they decided to share their resources. The Methodist, United Reform church and the Parish Hall were sold to help finance work on the Parish Church including an extension to serve as a church hall. Although the three churches still hold seperate weekly services and group meetings, there is shared worship and joint Christian activites.
